instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: Jump start Macbook Air - Possible?
threads.message:
Hi, my client macbook air is water damaged. Ive done ultra sonic. The light is coming on dc jack.
But i cant start the laptop when pushing start button on keyboard. Is there anywhere i can jumpstart the laptop?
or is there any other problem u might suggest I do beforehand?

Thanks

threads.title: Jump start Macbook Air - Possible?
threads.message: what board is this??? Search on boardview for SMC_ONOFF_L... Also remove battery and it should auto turn on when connect charger........

threads.title: Jump start Macbook Air - Possible?
threads.message:
thank you for quick answer.

its 820-00165-A
Macbook Air

threads.title: Jump start Macbook Air - Possible?
threads.message: well, use boardview to find the signal, also try without battery and plug charger, if it does not power on by itself measure voltage on PPBUS_G3H....

threads.title: Jump start Macbook Air - Possible?
threads.message: I found the SMC_ONOFF_L on schematics.. What do u want me to look for? thank you

threads.title: Jump start Macbook Air - Possible?
threads.message: Ok, im going toc heck PPBUS_G3H... Hold on pls!

threads.title: Jump start Macbook Air - Possible?
threads.message: Does the light turn green and then orange? Need PPBUS voltage. Some of these board will only power on when a good battery is connected. R5115, 5116 are the power on pads. These boards should however power on be themselves if all power has been removed including disconnecting the battery of course.

threads.title: Jump start Macbook Air - Possible?
threads.message:
Yes the light goes green and then orange.. and stays at orange.. I have disconnected the battery. Since Im quite new to schematics reading, please bare with me and Im sure we solve it together. 

On  PPBUS_G3H.. what singal/volt should I check for.. I attached 3 screenshot. is this correct place to look?

threads.title: Jump start Macbook Air - Possible?
threads.message: When i check diode mode on this resistor 5116: it shows zero volt.. Should it be like that?

threads.title: Jump start Macbook Air - Possible?
threads.message: This one.. ?

threads.title: Jump start Macbook Air - Possible?
threads.message:
You simply check the voltage on PPBUS, F7140 is an easy place to do that.

Why are you checking diode mode on R5116? Also diode mode most not be used when power is applied!

threads.title: Jump start Macbook Air - Possible?
threads.message: Ok, i see.. U want me to check it with voltage on.. Ok. I will check the voltage on PPBUS, F7140... I get back to you asap..

threads.title: Jump start Macbook Air - Possible?
threads.message: HI Duke. I put the red probe on ground, and black on F7140.. the DMM shows 0,999 m... What does that reading tell you?

threads.title: Jump start Macbook Air - Possible?
threads.message: now i got another reading: 09,97 m...

threads.title: Jump start Macbook Air - Possible?
threads.message:
No Title

this is NOSTUFF resistor, it is also easy to find since this pad is pretty big and present on both sides of the board.

threads.title: Jump start Macbook Air - Possible?
threads.message:
[QUOTE="Inwerp, post: 34973"]this is NOSTUFF resister, it is also easty to find since this pad is pretty big and present on both sides of the board.

[/QUOTE]

Thanks for replying.. What do u suggest I do with this resistor?

threads.title: Jump start Macbook Air - Possible?
threads.message:
[QUOTE="lagadatorumea, post: 35003"]

Thanks for replying.. What do u suggest I do with this resistor?[/QUOTE]

NOSTUFF means that there's actually nothing here. you just short this pad with tweezers and it is equal to power button on the keyboard. 

don't be mad but i suggest you to watch 10-100 Louis's videos with corresponding boardview and pdf opened and try to follow his trace. 
i'm telling you that because it was my daily practice quite a while and it is much better than knowing things like "where is power override" on some particullar board. if you know purpoise and main pins of SMC, you need just one second to find how to power on or SMC reset almost any Mac board.

threads.title: Jump start Macbook Air - Possible?
threads.message:
[QUOTE="Inwerp, post: 35004"]

NOSTUFF means that there's actually nothing here. you just short this pad with tweezers and it is equal to power button on the keyboard.

don't be mad but i suggest you to watch 10-100 Louis's videos with corresponding boardview and pdf opened and try to follow his trace.
i'm telling you that because it was my daily practice quite a while and it is much better than knowing things like "where is power override" on some particullar board. if you know purpoise and main pins of SMC, you need just one second to find how to power on or SMC reset almost any Mac board. [/QUOTE]

Ok.. i saw your reply now.. thank you!

threads.title: Jump start Macbook Air - Possible?
threads.message:
[QUOTE="lagadatorumea, post: 34971"]HI Duke. I put the red probe on ground, and black on F7140.. the DMM shows 0,999 m... What does that reading tell you?[/QUOTE]

Well to start, you have the polarity inverted. Red probe (positive) should go on F7140 and Black on ground (negative) in an optimal case, but for voltage we can just ignore the negative (-) indicator for now.

0.999 m what? 0.999mV? 0.999mOhm?

Let us know the voltage on PPBUS_G3H with power applied and your multimeter set to Voltage mode (The "V" indicator, just to be sure: don't use the "mV" for this one). If you know how to, also report back the voltage of PP3V42_G3H.

Also I agree with [USER="1309"]Inwerp[/USER], you should probably check some of louis's introduction videos
